txt.en: Kâwon-weni-Khûrs can be found in Bhol Rûdh.\n\nYou should talk to Kâwon-weni-Khûrs.
'Long ago, Red Sky Clan live peacefully with Alashi and Easterlings in Mesha Omûr, the Living Wood. The Chaydash was as pure as glittery jewels.'

'Then, the gods fought. Their great battle caused earthquakes. The mountains rose and the valley became Batakh Inâ, the Stinging Bog. Soon, Red Sky Clan can no longer reach the valley, trapped by mountains.'
'We live out our lives peacefully in Bhol Rûdh. The Great Eye cannot reach us here.'
Kâwon-weni-Khûrs is the village historian of the Red Sky Clan. Listen to his words to learn the history of his people.
Kâwon-weni-Khûrs and his statues can be found in Bhol Rûdh.\n\nYou should examine the Drúadan statues and listen to Kâwon-weni-Khûrs.
'Burning Mountain erupts again. The way to the valley is again opened, but it has become infested with evil and plague.'
Kâwon-weni-Khûrs and his statues can be found in Bhol Rûdh.\n\nYou should examine the Drúadan statues and listen to Kâwon-weni-Khûrs.
Kâwon-weni-Khûrs and his statues can be found in Bhol Rûdh.\n\nYou should examine the Drúadan statues and listen to Kâwon-weni-Khûrs.
Kâwon-weni-Khûrs and his statues can be found in Bhol Rûdh.\n\nYou should examine the Drúadan statues and listen to Kâwon-weni-Khûrs.
'Outsider. I am Kâwon-weni-Khûrs. You come to learn the struggles of my people. You shall know. The statues tell our history.'
'It is a time of great change. The statue I now carve tells the next story, if we survive.'
